{{also|SAMPLE}}
==English==

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|enm|en}} {{m|enm|sample}}, {{m|enm|asaumple}}, from {{etyl|fro|en}} {{m|fro|essample||example}}, from {{etyl|la|en}} {{m|la|exemplum}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{rhymes|æmpəl|lang=en}}
* {{a|RP}} {{IPA|/ˈsɑːm.pəl/|lang=en}}
* {{rhymes|ɑːmpəl|lang=en}}
* {{a|US}} {{IPA|/ˈsæm.pəl/|lang=en}}

===Noun===
{{en-noun}}

# A [[part]] of anything taken or presented for inspection, or shown as evidence of the quality of the whole; a [[specimen]]; as, goods are often purchased by samples.
#: ''"I design this but for a sample of what I hope more fully to discuss."  -Woodward.''
# {{context|statistics|lang=en}} A subset of a [[population]] selected for measurement, observation or questioning, to provide statistical information about the population.
#: ''"...it is possible it [the Anglo-Saxon race] might stand second to the Scandinavian countries [in average height] if a fair '''sample''' of their population were obtained." Francis Galton et al. (1883). Final Report of the Anthropometric Committee, Report of the British Association for the Advancement of Science, [http://galton.org/cgi-bin/searchImages/galton/search/essays/pages/galton-1883-rba-anthro-report-final_14.htm p. 269].''
# {{context|cooking|lang=en}} a small piece of food for tasting, typically given away for free
# {{context|business|lang=en}} a small piece of some goods, for determining quality, colour, etc., typically given away for free
# {{context|music|lang=en}} Gratuitous borrowing of easily recognised phases (or moments) from other music (or movies) in a recording, used to emphasize a particular point by implying a certain context.
# {{context|obsolete|lang=en}} [[example|Example]]; [[pattern]].
#* Shakespeare
#*: a '''sample''' to the youngest
#* Fairfax
#*: Thus he concludes, and every hardy knight / His '''sample''' followed.

====Synonyms====
* [[specimen]]
* [[example]]

* [[product sample]]

===Verb===
{{en-verb|samples|sampling|sampled}}

# {{context|transitive|lang=en}} To make or show something similar to; to match.
# {{context|transitive|lang=en}} To take or to test a sample or samples of; as, to sample sugar, teas, wool, cloth.
# {{context|transitive|signal processing|lang=en}} To reduce a [[continuous]] [[signal]] (such as a sound wave) to a [[discrete]] signal.
# {{context|transitive|lang=en}} To reuse a portion of (an existing sound recording) in a new song.
